summary: The iPhone business is already flatlining, and a lucrative $20 billion deal with Google could go up in smoke . Apple has been shifting some production from China to India . Manufacturing iPhones in the U.S. would likely be prohibitively expensive, leading to prices well out of reach for many iPhone users .  The trade war instigated by the Trump administration has cooled over the past month . New tariff threats against Apple and the European Union raise the specter of a reescalation that could push the U.S. economy into recession . Higher iPhone prices due to tariffs, coupled with an economic slowdown would be a double whammy for Apple .  Apple receives around $20 billion annually from Google to make Google the default search engine on its devices . With Alphabet losing against the U.S. Department of Justice in antitrust cases, the writing may be on the wall for Apple's lucrative deal with Google .  Despite Apple's sluggish growth, Apple stock is surprisingly expensive . Apple stock trades for around 27 times earnings . The worst-case scenario for Apple is the loss of the Google deal combined with significant tariffs on its products . Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia are among the stocks covered by The Motley Fool . The company's stock has more than 1.6 million shares, according to the firm's analysts .

New iPhone 15 Pro Max now has a trade-in value of up to 5,700 Chinese yuan, an increase from 5,625 yuan . Apple has increased the value for old iPhones to up to 4,750 yuan from 4,725 yuan . This initiative aims to stimulate demand in a crucial market where the company has faced increasing competition and declining sales .  In Q1 2025, Apple's iPhone shipments in China fell by 8% year-on-year . Its smartphone market share in the country decreased from 15% to 13%, according to Canalys data . This follows earlier direct price cuts by Apple in January 2025, including up to 500 yuan off the iPhone 16 Pro . Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a technology company known for its consumer electronics, like iPhones and MacBooks . Evercore ISI reiterated the stock as “Outperform” The firm said it’s sticking by the stock despite several uncertain issues .  Analysts on Wall Street currently have a consensus “Buy” rating on the stock . Gene Munster, Managing Partner at Deepwater Asset Management, has warned that OpenAI represents the first serious competitive threat to Apple . Overall, AAPLranks 5thon our list of AI stocks on the Wall Street’s radar .  Insider Monkey. published atInsider Monkey . published at Insider Monkey.com. Share your photos with us at iReport.com .

Foxconn plans to invest $1.5 billion in a new display module plant near Chennai, India . The facility will assemble screen components for iPhones, including the touch interface and brightness control . The investment comes as Apple deepens its supply chain in India .  Apple reportedly aims to source all 60 million iPhones sold annually in the U.S. from Indian facilities by the end of next year . Earlier this month, President Donald Trump blasted Apple CEO Tim Cook for building all over India .  According to Counterpoint Research, India contributed 18% of global iPhone production in 2024 and is projected to reach 32% in 2025 . According to the report, the report added that the country will be a major market for Apple in the coming years .

Berkshire Hathaway doesn't pay dividends, but Buffett loves investing in companies that do . Buffett gravitates toward consumer-facing brands and core economic industries, like financial services and energy . A company that pays a growing dividend is typically healthy and profitably growing .  The iPhone revolutionized the technology sector and made Apple one of the world's largest companies . Berkshire Hathaway didn't invest in Apple until roughly a decade after the first iPhone launched . Apple reinitiated its dividend in 2012 and has raised it every year since .  Credit cards represent easily accessible capital, and American Express has built its brand around businesses and high earners . Buffett has owned Coca-Cola since 1988 . The company is a Dividend King with 63 consecutive annual dividend raises .  Coca-Cola develops new products, acquires emerging brands, and has unmatched distribution on a global scale . Buffett traded in and out of Bank of America during the 2007-2009 financial crisis .  Buffett has an affinity for the energy sector . Chevron is an integrated oil major with exploration and refining operations . The company has raised its dividend for 37 consecutive years and counting . Warren Buffett isn't known for his technology investments, but he will make an exception for particularly interesting players . He's held these two for years, and one is even his biggest position . Together, together, they make up more than 26% of his portfolio .  Warren Buffett bought Apple in the first quarter of 2016 and progressively added to his position until it became his very biggest . Even after Buffett sold shares of the company last year, it remains his largest holding . During the recent Berkshire Hathaway shareholder meeting, Buffett even thanked Cook for his performance .  Apple is infusing its products with AI in the form of Apple Intelligence . Apple wasn't first to the AI market, instead preferring to take its time to develop tools suited to its style . Cook says AI is making a difference for growth, with the iPhone 16 performing better in markets where it is available .  Apple stock has slipped in recent weeks on concerns about the company's manufacturing dependence on China . A recent initial deal between the two countries suggests the impact on companies such as Apple will be limited . Apple is trading at 28 times forward earnings estimates, down from 35 times at the start of the year .  Buffett says Amazon has "far surpassed anything I would have dreamt could have been done" Amazon Web Services (AWS) has become a giant in AI, a market expected to reach into the trillions of dollars by the 2030s .  The company is trading at 32 times forward earnings estimates, down from 45 times in December . It's well positioned to keep growing its AI customer base .
